intro: Hieracium halleri, commonly known as the Haller's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or toothed. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Hieracium halleri is an annual or biennial plant that thrives in temperate climates.
